sen.j: 桜田門外の変（さくらだもんがいのへん）は、安政7年3月3日（1860年3月24日）、江戸城桜田門外（東京都千代田区）にて水戸藩の浪士らが大老・井伊直弼の行列を襲撃し暗殺した事件。
sen.e: The Sakuradamongai Incident is a incident which Roshi (masterless samurai) and others of the Mito Domain attacked the procession of Tairo (chief minister), Naosuke Ii, and assassinated him outside the Sakuradamon Gate in Edo Castle (Chiyoda Ward, Tokyo) on March 24, 1860.

The Sakuradamongai Incident refers to the event of March 24, 1860, when the roshi (masterless samurai) of the Mito Domain attacked the Tairo (Chief Minister), Naosuke Ii, and assassinated him outside the Sakuradamon Gate of Edo Castle (Chiyoda Ward, Tokyo).

The Sakuradamongai Incident refers to the event of March 24, 1860, when the roshi (masterless samurai) of the Mito Domain attacked the procession including the Tairo (Chief Minister), Naosuke II, and assassinated him outside the Sakuradamon Gate of Edo-jo Castle (Chiyoda Ward, Tokyo).
sen.cmt: 「江戸城」及び「井伊直弼」の表記を、仕様書に従い変更し、また、「行列」の英訳を再挿入しました。

sen.j: 孝明天皇から勅許が得られないまま独断で安政五カ国条約に調印し、一橋派・南紀派の将軍継嗣問題を裁決したうえ、安政の大獄で反対勢力を弾圧していた井伊直弼に対し、藩主の父・徳川斉昭への謹慎処分などで特に反発の大きかった水戸藩では、高橋多一郎や金子孫二郎などの過激浪士が脱藩した。
sen.e: As opposed to Naosuke Ii, who had oppressed counterinfluences with the mass imprisonment of Ansei on top of signing the Five Nations Treaty of Ansei at his own discretion without obtaining any imperial authorization from the Emperor Komei and deciding on a problem of heir of Shogun between Hitotsubashi group and Nanki group, radical samurais such as Taichiro TAKAHASHI and Magojiro KANEKO in the Mito Domain which strongly repulsed him in particular because of the confinement punishment of Nariaki TOKUGAWA, father of the lord of domain, left the clan and were planning the rebellion against Ii, and contacting Jizaemon ARIMURA and others of the Satsuma Domain to organize the troop of justice by making soldiers of the Satsuma Domain proceed to Kyoto and obtain the imperial letter of order to attack him from Emperor Komei, but the plan to unite the two domains was checked due to changes in inter domain situations of the Satsuma clan.

Ii Naosuke was a man who had arbitrarily signed the Five Nations Treaty of Ansei without imperial sanction from Emperor Komei, and decided on the successor for the Hitotsubashi and Nanki families, and who had also suppressed the opposition to the Ansei no Taigoku (the suppression of extremists by the Shogunate); his opposition was a group of roshi (masterless samurai) from the Mito Domain, including Taichiro TAKAHASHI and Magojiro KANEKO, who were strongly opposed to the confinement and punishment of Nariaki TOKUGAWA, the father and lord of the Domain.

sen.j: 彼らは薩摩藩の有村次左衛門などと連絡し、薩摩の率兵上京による義軍及び孝明天皇の勅書をもっての謀反を企てていたが、薩摩藩内の情勢の変化などにより、両藩士合同の計画は頓挫。

sen.j: 当日の早朝、一行は決行前の宴を催し一晩過ごした東海道品川宿（東京都品川区）の旅籠を出発し、東海道（現在の国道15号）に沿って進み、大木戸を経て札ノ辻を曲がり、網坂（東京都港区 (東京都)、慶應義塾大学付近）、神明坂、中之橋（現在の首都高速都心環状線を過ぎる）を過ぎて桜田通りへ抜け、愛宕神社 (東京都港区)（港区）で待ち合わせたうえで、外桜田門へ向かう。
sen.e: Early that morning the group left the inn at the Shinagawa (Shinagawa Ward, Tokyo) on the Tokaido highway where they had a pre-attack party, proceeded along Tokaido (present National Route 15), turned at Fudanotsuji after passing Okido and headed for the Sakuradamon Gate, passing Amisaka (Minato Ward, Tokyo), Myojinzaka, Nakanohashi (present Tokyo Metropolitan Expressway ring route) and meeting at Atago Jinja Shrine on the Sakurada street.

Early that morning, the group left the inn at Shinagawa (Shinagawa Ward, Tokyo) where they had had a party the night before, and proceeded along the Tokaido (now the National Route 15); they turned at Fudanotsuji after going through Okido; they passed Amisaka (near present-day Keio University, Minato Ward, Tokyo), Myojinzaka and Nakanohashi (now the Tokyo Metropolitan Expressway Ring Route), and finally assembled at the Atago Jinja Shrine on the street leading to the Sakuradamon Gate.

sen.j: そして、江戸藩邸（現在憲政記念館の地）から内堀通り沿いに登城途中の直弼を江戸城外桜田門外（現在の桜田門交差点）で襲撃した（関係者一覧は下記）。
sen.e: And they attacked Naosuke outside the Sakuradamon gate out of the Edo-jo castle (present Sakuradamon Gate crossing) on his way to the edohantei (present Kensei-Kinenkan (Constitution Memorial Center)) through the Uchibori (moat within the castle walls) street. sen.j: 井伊家には警告が届いていたが、直弼はあえて護衛を強化しなかった。

sen.e: Since the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) started, a government has not had an idea itself of attacking a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) palanquin in the Edo City, and it provoked carelessness of the Hikone Domain side.

sen.j: そもそも爵位の基準は版籍奉還の時点の現石が基準であり、「安政の大獄の恨みで新政府に冷遇され、伯爵に落とされた」などというのは全くの俗説である。

sen.j: 直弼の嫡男である井伊直憲は有栖川宮家から夫人を迎えており、井伊家は旧譜代大名のなかでは、むしろ厚遇されたと考えるべきである。

sen.j: 桜田門外の変で敵対した水戸市と彦根市が和解して親善都市提携を結んだ時期は、事件発生から110年後の1970年であった。
sen.e: It was 1970, 110 years later from the occurrence of the incident, when Mito and Hikone which opposed by the Sakuradamongai Incident were reconciled, and connected goodwill town affiliation.

sen.j: 水戸からは偕楽園の梅、彦根からは堀の白鳥がそれぞれに送られた。

sen.j: 水戸と彦根を和解させた都市は敦賀市だが、敦賀は天狗党の乱が悉く殺された土地である。
sen.e: Although the city which reconciled Mito and Hikone is Tsuruga-shi (Tsuruga City in Fukui Prefecture), Tsuruga is the land by which Tenguto no Ran (Rebellion of Tenguto) was killed entirely.

sen.j: 水戸と敦賀が、天狗党の縁で姉妹都市提携を結んだ時期は1964年だった。
